db:abstract.db:para: The QCameraInfo class provides general information about camera devices.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QCameraInfo lets you query for camera devices that are currently available on the system.
The static functions defaultCamera() and availableCameras() provide you a list of all available cameras.
This example prints the name of all available cameras:
A QCameraInfo can be used to construct a QCamera. The following example instantiates a QCamera whose camera device is named 'mycamera':
You can also use QCameraInfo to get general information about a camera device such as description, physical position on the system, or camera sensor orientation.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QCameraInfo::QCameraInfo(const QByteArray &name = QByteArray())
db:section.db:para: Constructs a camera info object from a camera device name.
If no such device exists, the QCameraInfo object will be invalid and isNull() will return true.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QCameraInfo::QCameraInfo(const QCamera &camera)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a camera info object for camera.
You can use it to query information about the camera object passed as argument.
If the camera is invalid, for example when no camera device is available on the system, the QCameraInfo object will be invalid and isNull() will return true.

db:section.db:title: QCameraInfo::QCameraInfo(const QCameraInfo &other)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QCameraInfo::~QCameraInfo()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the QCameraInfo.

db:section.db:title: [static] QList<QCameraInfo> QCameraInfo::availableCameras(QCamera::Position position = QCamera::UnspecifiedPosition)
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of available cameras on the system which are located at position.
If position is not specified or if the value is QCamera::UnspecifiedPosition, a list of all available cameras will be returned.

db:section.db:title: [static] QCameraInfo QCameraInfo::defaultCamera()
db:section.db:para: Returns the default camera on the system.
The returned object should be checked using isNull() before being used, in case there is no default camera or no cameras at all.

db:section.db:title: QString QCameraInfo::description() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the human-readable description of the camera.

db:section.db:title: QString QCameraInfo::deviceName() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the device name of the camera
This is a unique ID to identify the camera and may not be human-readable.

db:section.db:title: bool QCameraInfo::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this QCameraInfo is null or invalid.

db:section.db:title: int QCameraInfo::orientation() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the physical orientation of the camera sensor.
The value is the orientation angle (clockwise, in steps of 90 degrees) of the camera sensor in relation to the display in its natural orientation.
You can show the camera image in the correct orientation by rotating it by this value in the anti-clockwise direction.

For example, suppose a mobile device which is naturally in portrait orientation. The back-facing camera is mounted in landscape. If the top side of the camera sensor is aligned with the right edge of the screen in natural orientation, the value should be 270. If the top side of a front-facing camera sensor is aligned with the right of the screen, the value should be 90.

db:section.db:title: QCamera::Position QCameraInfo::position() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the physical position of the camera on the hardware system.

db:section.db:title: bool QCameraInfo::operator!=(const QCameraInfo &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this QCameraInfo is different from other.

db:section.db:title: QCameraInfo &QCameraInfo::operator=(const QCameraInfo &other)
db:section.db:para: Sets the QCameraInfo object to be equal to other.

db:section.db:title: bool QCameraInfo::operator==(const QCameraInfo &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this QCameraInfo is equal to other.
